image.altText: Three memorial crosses in the ground with a rainbow in the distance.

props.synopsis: Jailed child killer Robert Farquharson is preparing to launch a fresh appeal against his conviction. He is currently serving a life sentence for the murder of his three young sons nearly two decades ago.

title.children: Robert Farquharson drove his sons into a lake and killed them. 19 years later he is set to appeal his life sentence

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears high-vis and a hard hat.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the number of jobs created since Labor was elected is a record for a first-term government. Is that correct? RMIT ABC Fact Check takes a look.

title.children: Fact check: Has Labor created more jobs in 21 months than any other first-term government?

image.altText: A silhouette of a couple walking on a beach, everything is red at sunset, people fishing in the background

props.synopsis: Are major renewable energy projects being unfairly targeted by federal environment laws as some groups claim? We take a look at the numbers.

title.children: The 8,000-worker town that was never built and what it tells us about the renewables vs biodiversity debate

image.altText: Seoul Searching

props.synopsis: South Korea once "sold off" babies to international families. Now adoptees are coming home and looking for answers.

title.children: Before K-pop and gadgets, South Korea had a global export in babies. As adults, they want answers

image.altText: Beauty salon owner April Brodie.

props.synopsis: Australians are being told to brace for a tidal wave of small businesses going bust, and the job losses that may come with that.

title.children: April runs two beauty services — the high-end one is booming, the other struggling. It’s a microcosm of the economy

image.altText: An Aboriginal man in traditional bodypaint kneels in the waters of a spring with reeds in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Queensland government officials have given sworn statements saying Adani's mine could be "causing environmental harm" to protected wetlands after CSIRO rejected the miner's groundwater modelling as "not fit for purpose".

title.children: Adani mine could be 'causing environmental harm', say Queensland government officials

image.altText: A row of armoured vehicles travels along dry grassland

props.synopsis: Former military and intelligence leaders, including the former chief of Australia's Defence Force, say the government has "astonishingly" forgotten the risk of climate change in its defence strategy.

title.children: Former defence chief says government 'doesn't understand' climate change risk to Australia's security

image.altText: a crowd of protesters edited in black and white, a sign says girls just want to feel safe

props.synopsis: The federal government has committed to permanent funding to help women escape violence and online measures including an age verification trial to block children accessing pornography. But not everyone is convinced those measures will work.

title.children: 'Slap a $925 million bandaid on the outcry': Program to support victims fleeing violence leaves survivors feeling 'let down'

image.altText: Cabinet ministers Katy Gallagher, Amanda Rishworth and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese at an anti-violence rally in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Almost $1 billion is being spent on permanently establishing a program helping victim-survivors of violence leave. This is what we know about how it will work.

title.children: Victim-survivors can get $5,000 to escape violent relationships, here’s how it works

image.altText: A man wearing a black shirt looks seriously off-camera. Behind him is faint Aboriginal print and the town of Alice Springs.

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal-controlled organisation paid tens of millions of dollars in government grants each year has come under fire for declining meetings, allegedly failing to deliver services adequately and allowing a convicted domestic violence offender to sit on its board.

title.children: 'Step up or get out the way': Aboriginal corporation criticised over absence in Alice Springs crisis

image.altText: Graphic of Bruce Lehrmann and Lisa Wilkinson with question marks in the background

props.synopsis: Justice Michael Lee reserved his decision on costs in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case against Network Ten and Lisa Wilkinson, but has ruled on some issues.

title.children: The latest Bruce Lehrmann defamation case hearing provided some answers, but key questions remain

image.altText: A large number of people outside the ruins of a large temple

props.synopsis: They say money can't buy you happiness, but at Europe's busiest tourist hot spots, it can buy you peace and quiet, and experts say a trend of reducing visitor numbers and offering pricey private tours is here to stay.

title.children: 'I'm surprised it's taken this long': Why Europe's most famous tourist attractions are turning people away

image.altText: A smiling woman holding a bouquet of flowers

props.synopsis: Point Cook woman Samantha Heberlein has been found alive and well in North Melbourne, six days after her car broke down in far East Gippsland.

title.children: Missing woman Samantha Heberlein found six hours' drive from her broken down car, six days later

image.altText: A split image showing a young blonde woman and a middle-aged blonde woman, both smiling.

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan says the Attorney-General and representatives from the Magistrates' Court will meet to discuss ways to ensure men's behavioural change programs continue in Ballarat.

title.children: 'Shocking' move to axe men's behavioural change program in city rocked by three alleged murders of women

image.altText: Anthony Albanese gets into the PM's car outside parliament house

props.synopsis: In the lead-up to this year's budget announcement, the Albanese government is struggling to maintain the public's focus and clear air to announce its plans.

title.children: With less than two weeks until the budget is handed down, the government is juggling crises and struggling for clear air

image.altText: A selfie of Leisa Prescott hooked up to a machine in hospital.

props.synopsis: It took more than two decades for Leisa Prescott to receive a diagnosis after suffering with inflamed abscesses and nodules on her skin.

title.children: Women are more likely to be impacted by this rare skin condition severely under-researched in Australia

image.altText: Harley Reid running

props.synopsis: West Coast allows young gun Harley Reid to fly to Victoria to see his family while being rested, and AFL great Paul Roos believes it could lead the club down a slippery slope.

title.children: 'It's not a great look': Eagles criticised over Reid's Victorian break

image.altText: A white woman with long dark brown hair wearing a blue suit and matching blue earrings

props.synopsis: The veteran ABC investigative journalist says writing Pheasants Nest was a kind of therapy for the secondary trauma she has experienced on the job.

title.children: Police PTSD is an issue no-one wants to know about, says veteran journo Louise Milligan

image.altText: White pill bottles with out of stock labels on a purple, green and orange background.

props.synopsis: Doctors say patients are having trouble getting blood pressure medications and other medicines for issues like autoimmune diseases.

title.children: 'Their blood pressure's through the roof': Why pregnant women are struggling to access essential medications

image.altText: troy sivan wears a sparkly, disco ball button-up shirt

props.synopsis: From Dean Lewis to Taylor Swift – here are the big winners at this year's APRA Awards.

title.children: Musicians have voted: Is this the best Australian song of the year?

image.altText: A stock market watcher stands in front of an ASX board.

props.synopsis: NAB says its half-year profit fell 11.9 per cent from intense competition in the lending industry, while the Australian share market is likely to fall after the US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell indicates a US rate hike is unlikely. Follow live.

title.children: ASX to slip, NAB half-year profit drops 11.9pc, Federal Reserve indicates US rate hike is 'unlikely'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Millions of Club NSW patrons potentially affected by data breach
US Presidential election 'just isn't part of our thinking', Fed chair Powell says
US interest rate hike is 'unlikely', Jerome Powell says

image.altText: colours and numbers light up a gaming machine

props.synopsis: Premier Chris Minns and Police Minister Yasmin Catley named in possible data breach in licensed venues across NSW.

title.children: Politicians reportedly among 1 million NSW club patrons affected by potential data breach

image.altText: Parramatta children's court

props.synopsis: One of four Sydney teenagers accused of planning a terrorist attack allegedly suggested targeting Jewish community members in a group chat, a court has heard.

title.children: Teen allegedly wanted to target 'a bunch of Jews' in terrorist attack, court hears

image.altText: A man in a grey hoodie holds a large wooden pole while another man next to him holds a metal fence in the air

props.synopsis: Footage of the clashes at the University of California in Los Angeles, shows people wielding sticks and letting off fireworks.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian protesters attacked, hundreds arrested in increasingly violent encampment

image.altText: Tools and wood lie on a broken church floor

props.synopsis: An increasing number of do-it-yourself renovations by landlords in the rental market has raised concerns around what a lack of policing could mean for renters if it the work is not done correctly.

title.children: Tenants enduring shoddy home repairs as DIY trend leads to 'landlord specials'

image.altText: A calico cat standing up with its tail raised.

props.synopsis: Galena found herself at the centre of a stressful trip in an Amazon package, a feverish search, a California rescue and a tearful reunion.

title.children: Housecat who enjoys exploring cardboard boxes accidentally posted 860km in Amazon order return

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Domestic violence advocates and legal experts are calling for changes to bail laws to protect women following the death of Molly Ticehurst in regional NSW last week.

title.children: A specific change to NSW bail laws 'could save lives', domestic violence advocates and legal experts say

image.altText: A man sits with his hand on his head.

props.synopsis: The 72-year-old is facing a retrial, likely in September, after a court finding that "prior bad acts" testimony violated his right to a fair trial.

title.children: Harvey Weinstein's 2020 rape conviction to be retried in court

image.altText: A woman basketball coach is standing on the sidelines, watching a game.

props.synopsis: A chance encounter in 2022 changed Lauren Robinson's career path, as she transitioned into becoming a wheelchair basketball coach.

title.children: Lauren Robinson's unexpected journey to becoming a wheelchair basketball coach

image.altText: Australian golfer Jason Day, following through with an iron shot, on the tee in a tournament.

props.synopsis: Jason Day heads into this week's US PGA tournament as defending champion, something he has not been in five years.

title.children: 'Letting me down': Day hoping improved iron play will help first title defence in five years

image.altText: A side profile of Ziggy Ramo with cornrows, beard and moustache, blue shirt, blue sky with clouds behind him

props.synopsis: Ziggy Ramo has taken a three-dimensional approach to his new project delivering a book, an album and incorporating visual art by his sister Brydi Fatnowna. He describes it as a sprawling "pick your own adventure".

title.children: A behind-the-scenes look at the making of Ziggy Ramo's Human?

image.altText: Nikki Davey wearing a red jumper stands behind potted flowers on a flower farm.

props.synopsis: Nikki Davey shares her approach for scheduling downtime every week, the 1 per cent rule for improvement, and the value in learning something new.

title.children: How the '1 per cent rule' has helped busy flower farmer Nikki Davey
